column5: A few years ago, one of the threads that I can't find, had a link to a site that showed daily satellite images of Lake Superior, etc. I need it to check if the ice is out in certain spots before we fly there. Hope some one can help out. thanks...Alan
http://www.coastwatch.msu.edu/superior/s.html  i use this one...dont know if thats the one or not

You guys are amazingly fast. When I go to the region map at the site, I can't download or view the map. It say "forbidden", but I did see Anders direct link to Lake Superior. Unless my memory is playing tricks, I remember the image showed more detail like a Google map, only updated like Coastwatch. Thanks guys.
This is the site i use the most....whole world coverage!!!  http://rapidfire.sci.gsfc.nasa.gov/subsets/#NorthAmerica  Just click on the area your interested in and pick your map and zoom.  Jason
This might suit your purposes also. Good for the whole world. http://www.flashearth.com/
